intro: Antidesma brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed antidesma, is a small evergreen shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by small, fleshy fruits. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its compact size and ornamental leaves make it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
